title: Blackstone to Buy Preferred Apartment Communities in $5.8 Billion Deal
sub_head: Acquisition underscores strong investor demand for multifamily properties in Sunbelt states
body:
Blackstone Inc. has agreed to buy rental apartment owner Preferred Apartment Communities Inc. in a $5.8 billion deal that demonstrates the strong investor demand for multifamily properties in Sunbelt states.
Atlanta-based Preferred Apartment owns over 40 rental apartment properties with about 12,000 units in states including Georgia, Florida, North Carolina and Tennessee. Blackstoneâ€™s all-cash purchase values the real-estate investment trust at $25 per share, according to the companies.
